channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Breaking Bad’ creator’s new show ‘Pluribus’ was emphatically ‘made by humans,’ not AI
item.description: If you watched all the way to the end of the new Apple TV show “Pluribus,” you may have noticed an unusual disclaimer in the credits: “This show was m...

item.title: A Gene Editing Therapy Cut Cholesterol Levels by Half
item.description: An experimental gene-editing therapy developed by Crispr Therapeutics is showing promise for treating heart disease.

item.title: The 42 Best Movies on Netflix, WIRED’s Picks (November 2025)
item.description: Frankenstein, The Twits, and The Running Man are just a few of the movies you should watch on Netflix this month.

item.title: Gear News of the Week: Fairphone Lands in the US, and WhatsApp Is Finally on the Apple Watch
item.description: Plus: Motorola has new Moto G phones, Canon’s R6 III mirrorless has a 32-MP sensor, and Teenage Engineering’s Riddim n’ Ting looks gorgeous.

item.title: Trump’s Hatred of EVs Is Making Gas Cars More Expensive
item.description: Trump’s anti-climate agenda is making it more expensive to own a car, period.

item.title: The 42 Best Shows on Netflix, WIRED's Picks (November 2025)
item.description: The Witcher, Boots, and House of Guinness are just a few of the shows you need to watch on Netflix this month.

item.title: OpenAI asked Trump administration to expand Chips Act tax credit to cover data centers
item.description: A recent letter from OpenAI reveals more details about how the company is hoping the federal government can support the company's ambitious plans for ...

item.title: How startups can lure good talent fairly without big tech bank accounts
item.description: Three industry insiders walk through how startups can set up an employee equity strategy that remains fair as a company grows.

item.title: Is Wall Street losing faith in AI?
item.description: A rough week for tech stocks might signal a loss of investor confidence in artificial intelligence.

item.title: Rivian gives RJ Scaringe a new pay package worth up to $5B
item.description: The company canceled a similar-sized award from 2021, when EV optimism was sky-high, due to the "unlikeliness" that the associated goals could be met.
